item.title: Bio-101 for AI Community
item.description: Amino acids and proteins The basic molecule units of proteins are amino acids. A amino acid consists of three major groups: amino ($-\text{NH}_3^+)$, carboxylic acid ($-\text{CO}_2{\text H}$) and a side chain ($\text{R}$). The carbon that attaches amino group is called alpha carbon. The following figure illustrates the simple structure of an amino acid. The general structure of amino acid that consists of three groups: amino, carboxylic acid and side chain
